alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Crawford; Houston; Peach (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:09PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron affecting Houston, Bibb, Crawford and Peach Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, East Juliette, Dames Ferry, West Macon, Macon, Clinchfield, Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Houston Road. Portions of creek access roads and low lying areas will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 15.8 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Thursday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 02/08/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
